{"step_by_step_thinking": "Iodine is primarily important in the biochemical synthesis of thyroid hormones thyroxine (T4) and triiodothyronine (T3). Thyroxine is synthesized by attaching iodine atoms to tyrosine residues on thyroglobulin, a protein produced by the thyroid gland. The iodine atoms are added by the enzyme thyroperoxidase (TPO) in the presence of hydrogen peroxide. Therefore, the correct answer is B. Thyroxine.", "answer_choice": "B"}
